Glenn Matlin

Ph.D. Student in Machine Learning | Georgia Tech

Researching AI for high-stakes domains • DARPA-funded researcher Publications in NeurIPS

Welcome

I’m a Ph.D. student in Computer Science at Georgia Tech, specializing in artificial intelligence, language models, and machine learning for high-stakes and knowledge-intensive domains including finance, law, and national security. My DARPA-supported research focuses on developing collaborative AI systems and intelligent assistants capable of tackling complex financial, economic, and strategic challenges.

🏆 Recent Recognition

1st Prize - 2023 GT School of CS Ph.D. Research Competition

📚 Top Venues

Publications in NeurIPS Leading ML/NLP conferences

🚀 DARPA Funded

Research Interests

  • Financial AI: Applications of ML in financial domains
  • Natural Language Processing: Text analysis and generation
  • Machine Learning Systems: Infrastructure and deployment
